title: Software Engineer - Backend
summary: Microsoft 365 (M365) Intelligent Conversation and Communications Cloud is the platform that powers billions of real-time customer conversations across Microsoft…
job description:
Microsoft 365 (M365) Intelligent Conversation and Communications Cloud is the platform that powers billions of real-time customer conversations across Microsoft’s first-party (Teams, Skype), second-party (Dynamics), and third-party solutions (through Azure Communication Services). The platform enables reliable and high-quality messaging, meeting, and audio/video calling services that work every time, from anywhere, seamlessly across all customer touchpoints. Conversations on our platforms are made more intelligent in real-time, empowering best-in-class productivity tools for the modern workplace where every call, meeting, or chat will make the next one better.
 


 We are the team behind all the messaging scenarios across multiple products, and develop one of the largest scale, business-critical distributed systems in Microsoft. Our services run in 25+ regions, and we process billions of messages a day, enabling hundreds of millions of active enterprise as well as consumer users. The micro services are highly scalable, highly available, and extremely performant in geo-redundant, multi-tenant systems and honor data sovereignty, privacy, security, and compliance. You will have an opportunity to work with a highly collaborative and fun team in a fast-learning environment.
 
 Responsibilities

 Design, develop and operate features for large scale distributed software services and solutions.
 Adhere to modern software engineering practices through design and code reviews.
 Write clean and optimized code, improve test coverage for services, organize and implement integration tests, and resolve problem areas.
 Consider testability, portability/monitoring, reliability, and maintainability, and understand when code is ready to be shared and delivered.
 Gain a working understanding of Microsoft as a business and collaborate with mentors and leaders in order to contribute to cohesive, end-to-end experiences for our users.
 Focus on customer/partner needs through a data driven approach.
 Develop “best-in-class” engineering for our services by ensuring that the services and the components are well-defined and modularized, secure, reliable, diagnosable, actively monitored and reusable.

 Qualifications

 Required/Minimum Qualifications:


 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline.
 2+ years technical engineering experience with any object-oriented coding languages including, but not limited to C++, C#, Java or Python.
   
 OR equivalent experience.



 Preferred qualifications:


 3+ years designing, developing, and operating backend services.
 Ability to communicate technical details clearly across organizational boundaries.
 Experience in DevOps to maintain live services and/or application frameworks.
 Cloud and services experience, with Azure cloud experience highly desirable.
 Excellent analytical skills with systematic and structured approach to software design.
 Passion for building highly scalable, highly reliable services.
 Experience with or exposure to Agile and iterative development processes.


   #IC3
   #M365CORE
 

   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
 


 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: CMM Technician & Programmer
summary: Burloak is known for superiority when producing complicated prototype parts for a large variety of industries.Responsible for validating probes daily.
job description:
CMM Technician & Programmer
Burloak Tool & Die Ltd.
Burloak is known for superiority when producing complicated prototype parts for a large variety of industries. All tooling is designed in-house using (3-D) VISI software. We take pride in the fact that all the necessary tooling components including custom die shoes are machined in-house using our state-of-the-art CNC equipment.
Burloak designers have experience with machine design, automotive progressive dies, die transfer, and part development/prototypes. Burloak is the “go to” organization for quality parts, quick turn around and on-time delivery. Burloak has the ability to produce parts of any quantity while strictly adhering to drawing specifications and tolerances. Known for high quality prototype parts, it is a challenge to decipher if those parts were produced off hard tooling. Burloak provides a full in-house stamping facility. Presses and feed lines range from 40 Ton to 800 Ton.
Burloak's in-house stamping department not only provides our customer with quality parts, it also provides added value, with spot welding, surface coatings, a robotic weld cell and a full assembly line.
Responsibilities
Your responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

Responsible for establishing CMM Programs and maintaining electronic files
Responsible for validating probes daily
Responsible for performing CMM Layout Inspection on manufactured parts
Strong understanding in GD&T and interpretation of engineering drawings
Establishing CMM Set-Up Instructions when required
Perform First-Off, In-Process and Final Inspections of manufactured product
Responsible for maintaining Gage Calibration Master Lists up to date
Responsible for championing gage calibration program
Contacting external providers for calibration quotes and services
Record inspection activities as required
Measure parts with calibrated instruments and tools
Verify production against “Master Sample” and in conjunction with production fixtures
Train Press Operators in use of Production Fixtures and Quality Issues
Assist in the resolution / implementation of corrective actions

Why join team BURLOAK?
Great Compensation

Competitive wages
Signing Bonus
Paid breaks
Cash Referral Bonus for bringing people to join the team

Strong Benefits Programs

Competitive benefits for you & your family, with Dental, Extended Health, Life, Disability, Vision, etc.
Employee Assistance Program
Pension Plan with company contributions
Paid sick days
Extra vacation days based on experience for new team members

Great Company

Great location near highways, with free on-site parking, and also near transit
Well-established company of 40+ years
Under new ownership, designed for growth
Interesting work – Burloak is active in appliance, automotive, heavy duty, and more
Great customers – Burloak has established relationships with top quality customers
Fully integrated shop – Design, toolmaking, CNC shop, Press (40-800t), welding, and more
Company events (Employee appreciation BBQs, for example)
Open door policy with management

Tools

Free uniforms
Tool financing program
Annual Safety Boot allowance

Training

Training provided as required
Outside training, company funds up to 100% of fees

We thank all candidates for their submissions and will be contacting applicants selected for interviews on a rolling basis starting immediately.
Burloak is an accessible workplace and we welcome applications from people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, that can be arranged for any part of the selection process for this position. We welcome applicants from all walks of life.

Salary: $22.00-$30.00 per hour
Supplemental pay types:

Overtime pay

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Machine Assembler / Developer
summary: Prodomax Automation Ltd. is hiring an experienced Machine Assembler/Developer..Our employees are mountain bikers, road bikers, skiers, golfers, runners,…
job description:
Prodomax Automation Ltd. is hiring an experienced Machine Assembler/Developer.
Our employees are mountain bikers, road bikers, skiers, golfers, runners, amateur chefs, video game heroes, musicians, community volunteers, race-car drivers, fitness enthusiasts, hockey players, outdoor sportspeople, TV & potato chip experts. We are a diverse and inclusive work culture - everyone is welcome.
Prodomax employees have the benefit of working for an entrepreneurial minded company, while collaborating with our JENOPTIK colleagues from many countries around the world. Prodomax Automation Ltd. is a member of JENOPTIK Group and is located in Barrie Ontario Canada. Prodomax is a specialized industrial engineering firm focused on designing complex automation with a blue-chip customer base since it was founded in 1971. Operating from 2 facilities totaling 200,000 square feet with 200+ employees; we are ISO 9001:2015 certified.
JENOPTIK, our parent company, is an integrated photonics company, employs 4,000 people with representatives in over 80 countries, and divides its activities into Light and Optics, Light and Production and Light and Safety divisions. Jenoptik’s key capabilities include optics, lasers, metrology and automation. Jenoptik services the automotive, life sciences and semi-conductor industries.
Prodomax supports growth within our Team Members and promotes from within whenever possible.
As a Machine Assembler/Developer, you will assemble equipment and develop the equipment to ensure that it meets all customer requirements (quality, cycle time, maintainability, etc.) and will report directly to the Production Manager.
Assembler/Developer Key Accountabilities:

Interact with shop floor and design personnel for engineering issues/drawing updates to aid in machine build activities
Ensure all work activities are completed according to the procedures or best practice
Maintain quality, generate issues lists related to the equipment, and provide that feedback to the necessary departments
Build to print activities, including mechanical tool assembly, plumbing, guarding assembly, etc.
Develop tools to the point that customer parts are being produced within the required geometric tolerances and within the required cycle time
Work within the project team to provide feedback to engineering to improve machine build efficiency and reduce cost
Utilize fundamentals in machine build practices and GD&T analysis to help engineering design equipment that will be cost effective and meet our customer needs
Travel to customer sites to install or service equipment at their facility, and be part of the team that starts up the equipment and completes the job onsite
Some heavy lifting
Mentor and lead Apprentices and Junior Machine Assemblers and Developers

Education:

Must have a Certificate of Qualification for one of the following trades: General Machinist, Tool & Die Maker, Mould Maker or Millwright.

Intermediate Assembler/Developer Key Professional Attributes:

3 - 5+ years direct working experience
Experience in building and trouble-shooting automated assembly equipment
Forklift and Fall Arrest Licenses are preferred
Experience with mills, lathes and other tool room equipment
Experience/general understanding of hydraulics and pneumatics
Experience with interpretation of mechanical and fluid power schematic drawings
Experience working to close tolerances and making equipment adjustments to meet those tolerances
Experience working in a high-pressure environment with dynamic requirements

The Ideal Candidate Demonstrates:

Positive attitude.
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, disciplined approach to work.
Ability to work well as a member of a team.
Ability to work well under pressure in a constantly changing environment.
Ability to coordinate a high level of activity under a variety of conditions and constraints.
Excellent conflict resolutions skills.
Excellent judgment and strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to understand the financial impact of relevant options.
High energy and the flexibility to perform under short time constraints to meet deadlines.
Ability to work regular and/or continental shift (when required)
Ability to work overtime.
Ability to travel.

Our Benefits:

Competitive salary and profit-sharing bonus
Comprehensive Group Health & Dental Benefit Plan
A competitive matching Registered Retirement Savings Plan and Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan
Employee assistance and wellness programs
Employee training, development, tuition, and professional fees reimbursement
Partial tuition reimbursement for employees’ Children enrolled in technical program at recognized Canadian college/university
Annual performance management review
Safe, professional work environment
Casual business dress
$3,000 (Senior) $2,000 (Intermediate) and $1000 (Junior) referral fees if you recommend an approved permanent hire – family & friends included
Safety shoes and safety glasses reimbursement
Prodomax Employee Excellence Recognition (PEER) Awards
Prodomax Barrie is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without discrimination or harassment because of race, ancestry, place of origin, color, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status or disability.
Applications are welcome from all qualified candidates. Accommodations may be available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you would like to request a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please advise your Human Resources contact when you are selected to participate in the recruitment process.

title: Web Designer & Developer
summary: *Before you apply, please note that you must currently live in Canada and you must have at least 1 full year of web design and development experience.*.
job description:
*Before you apply, please note that you must currently live in Canada and you must have at least 1 full year of web design and development experience.
Azuro Digital is one of Canada’s top rated & award winning web design agencies.
We treat our clients like partners, and we go above and beyond to exceed their expectations in every respect. Our websites are built to get found on Google, motivate website visitors to take action, and create a stunning impression of the brand.
To learn more about us, check out our website: https://www.azurodigital.com/
As a web designer at Azuro Digital, you’ll build websites for exciting companies and you’ll execute every stage of the process with tons of creative control. Please note that coding knowledge is NOT required for this position.
We’re looking for a highly motivated team member with strong communication skills, a keen eye for design, and a self-starter mentality.
Responsibilities:
- Design and develop stunning websites on WordPress using Elementor (no coding knowledge required & if you haven’t used WordPress or Elementor before, we’ll teach you)
- Work with the client to create a content outline that will optimize the user experience and conversion rate. From there, the client or a professional copywriter will provide the written content
- Implement basic SEO tasks (no prior SEO experience is required)
- Communicate directly with clients (via email, phone, and Zoom) to customize their website, fulfill their unique needs, and exceed their expectations
- Build and refine the agency’s standard operating procedures (SOPs) to optimize workflows and make the process straightforward for future employees
- Meet with prospective clients (virtually) to learn about their requirements and convince them to choose Azuro Digital if we’re a good fit for their project. Our owner will lead the sales process, but you will sometimes be asked to provide assistance
Requirements:
- At least 1 full year of web design and development experience
- Submit a portfolio of previous websites that you designed and developed. Your portfolio must be in the form of active website URLs (built with any platform)
- Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
- Motivated to take initiative, grow the company, and become a leader
- Must currently live in Canada
Nice-to-Haves:
- Experience with WordPress (especially the Elementor page builder)
- Experience with custom code and complex plugins
- Logo design experience
- Graphic design experience
- SEO experience
- Copywriting experience
Benefits:
- We’re a small agency and you will be treated like a “partner” rather than an employee. You will make a significant impact and will shape the future trajectory of our company
- Room for professional growth and salary increases
- Work from anywhere in Canada. The position is fully remote
- Health insurance coverage
Compensation:
The starting salary is $70,000 with room for growth.

Visual-Eyes is a leading practice management software for the eye care industry in Canada. We have been in business for over 25 years and are looking for a new Application Developer (Junior) to join our Red Deer team. summary: [An english version can be found below].Programmeur Analyste senior - responsable technique*.Relevant du directeur des opérations, le programmeur analyste…
job description:

Programmeur Analyste senior - responsable technique
1.0 Objectif du poste
Relevant du directeur des opérations, le programmeur analyste senior/responsable technique sera chargé de superviser l’élaboration et la validation de la stratégie technique pour les projets en cours et futurs et participera à l’élaboration du modèle applicatif de nos solutions. Le titulaire jouera un rôle clé dans la formation et l’orientation d’une équipe des développeurs analystes sur les meilleures pratiques, les nouvelles technologies et les corrections des « bugs ».
2.0 Responsabilités principales

Établir et maintenir les choix des technologies utilisées
Promouvoir l'échange et la rétroaction continus d'informations entre les membres de l'équipe.
Agir en tant que mentor/coach pour favoriser le développement professionnel et personnel.
Agir en tant qu'architecte des solutions développées et participer au choix stratégique des technologies utilisées avec la direction.
Gérez Travaillez avec une petite équipe expérimentée pour vous assurer que tous les aspects techniques fonctionnels fonctionnent bien ensemble en tant que solution complète.
Collaborer avec le responsable du produit pour examiner les exigences du produit, étudier le flux et les composants de la solution de bout en bout, et aider à décomposer les exigences en livrables fonctionnels.
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec notre QA pour définir des stratégies de test afin de garantir que les problèmes de développement sont détectés et corrigés avant le déploiement.
Comprendre le flux de travail ainsi que l'infrastructure et les outils.
Capacité à travailler avec les principes DRY, KISS et YAGNI pour déployer des fonctionnalités rapidement.
Améliorer continuellement le processus de développement global.

Documentation et développement de la base de connaissances

Le rendement sera mesuré en fonction des objectifs établis avec le Directeur des Operations. Les objectifs seront liés aux responsabilités énumérées dans le présent document. Les mesures de performance peuvent être ajustées en fonction des besoins de l'entreprise ou du service, ainsi qu'un changement dans la portée des responsabilités décrites pour ce rôle.

Respecter les délais des projets
Qualité de travaille

Baccalauréat en génie logiciel
Expérience pertinente en gestion d'équipe technique

Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et de communication combinées à un fort engagement envers le travail d'équipe
Excellentes compétences en gestion du temps et en organisation

Faire preuve d'un bon jugement et de compétences décisionnelles

Souci du détail, compétences éprouvées en résolution de problèmes et capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois
Capacité à gérer les objectifs et les performances des agents sur la base des données KPI par rapport aux objectifs fixés pour le département
Comportement et apparence professionnels en tout temps
Sociable et comprenez que la communication est la clé du succès d'une équipe ;

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1.0 Objective of the position
Reporting to the Director of Operations, the SeniorProgrammer Analyst - Technical Lead will be responsible for overseeing the development and validation of the technical strategy for current and future projects and will participate in the development of the application model of our solutions. The incumbent will play a key role in training and guiding a team of programmer analysts on best practices, new technologies, solutionsand bug fixes.

title: Jr. Full Stack JavaScript developer (Ontario Branch)
summary: Position Title: Jr. Full Stack JavaScript developer.Grow into a strong developer as you build your lifelong career at Plexxis.Job Type: Full time, permanent.
job description:
Position Title: Jr. Full Stack JavaScript developer
Reports to: Director, R&D
Job Type: Full time, permanent
Location: Brampton, ON
All successful candidates are required to reside within commuting distance of our Brampton, ON office location. Plexxis does not offer remote work opportunities.
Salary Range: $61,500 - $148,500

Summary
We're looking for Junior Full Stack developers to mentor and grow into superstars.
What You Will Do
As part of the Plexxis web development team, you will…

use react + node/express to create user interfaces and backend API calls as part of the ongoing effort to modernize our primary product offering
learn from more senior team members who direct your day-to-day activities
make meaningful contributions to a product that people rely on in their day-to-day business operations
grow into a strong developer as you build your lifelong career at Plexxis

Requirements

You like people
You are focused
You are supportive
You are driven
You like to work in a team but are fine working on your own when the occasion calls for it
You love coding and you love a good challenge
You know some JavaScript basics
You know some ReactJS basics, AngularJS basics, or VueJS basics
You know some NodeJS basics

Nice to Have

Personal projects that demonstrate your love of development
Developer training of some kind (boot-camp, college, university, etc.)
Typescript
OracleDB or any relational database exposure (sql)

What's it like working at Plexxis?
The dress is casual, but our commitment to quality is not. At Plexxis, the working environment is a social one - built on mutual respect and collaboration. We are a team of extremely hard-working individuals who have a steadfast dedication to delivering amazing results to our clients. As such, we make it a point to provide each of our employees with the tools needed to do their job well, including:

Competitive Salary
Benefits
Company gym
A games room
Paid after hours

Our team genuinely appreciates each other and there is an authentic camaraderie and support network.
About Plexxis Software:
The Plexxis Drywall Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software maximizes the profit and efficiency of wall & ceiling contractors through expert consulting and a drywall estimating software that unites digital takeoff, costing, construction management, mobile applications and accounting solutions into a single, sophisticated - yet simple system.
Since 1999, our sole focus has been dedicated to the wall and ceiling trade – a focus that has brought together an extraordinary wealth of knowledge, experience and expertise. From technology engineers, trainers and consultants, we have assembled the “right” people, the “right” product and the “right” service to deliver solutions unmatched in quality and customer focus.
Are you the perfect fit? Do you wish to …

Work with a small, tight-knit group of hard-working, dedicated and fun individuals
Enjoy the atmosphere of a rapidly growing, high energy company with an entrepreneurial spirit
Be on the winning team - poised to emerge as the global leader

job description:
100 King Street West Toronto Ontario,M5X 1A1 



We are seeking enthusiastic, passionate professionals for Development and Cloud Engineering, with extensive experience and focus on digitization. BMO’s digitization Cloud strategy is focused on innovation, leveraging rapidly emerging cloud native services to meet the rapidly evolving needs of our customers. BMO’s Commercial and Corporate Banking Technology team is leading the way at a Bank where our Purpose is Growing the Good and Being Bold. We demonstrate those values every day. Be part of the action – where we have challenging discussions about how to align those customer requirements to the right technology solutions and services. Help evolve the BMO’s core digitization platform, leveraging emerging best practices and tools, securely connected to our strategic suppliers, providing a platform for innovation to an entire Bank.

 Responsibilities:
 Working in a close-knit technical team, the role will:

 Development of critical technology functions across Sales & Origination, Underwriting, Booking, Portfolio Management and Risk Management technical platforms
 Hands on development experience
 Ability to adapt to and develop on both on-premise and cloud applications

 Required Core Skills:

 Minimum of 2-4 years of demonstrated hands-on experience in designing and configuring secure and scalable architecture patterns and technology solutions
 Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security).
 Working experience with Angular/ Node JS / Javascript/typescript , J2EE, Python, Oracle and Postgres and expertise in at least one of them
 Hands on with cloud technologies – ideally AWS
 Hands on experience with AI and Data (preferred)
 Ability to work in a structured environment, practicing both Waterfall and Agile development model
 Ability to work with distributed onshore and offshore teams

 Other Skills:

 Strong interpersonal and communication skills
 A critical thinker with strong research and analytics skills
 Self-motivated with a positive attitude and an ability to work independently and/or in a team
 Able to work under tight timelines and deliver on complex problems

We’re here to help
 At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
 As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en 
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
 Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Junior Front-End Engineer
summary: Wizebank is looking for a talented front-end developer to help us build best-in-class software and financial tools that help online education businesses better…
job description:
Wizebank has built the industry's first "Learn Now, Pay Later" solution specifically designed to help world-class course creators, educators, and coaches sell more effectively. We're trusted by our partners to drive meaningful improvements in their business, and we work tirelessly to do just that.
 Founded in 2021, Wizebank has gone from pre-product to helping our partners generate millions in monthly sales across tens of thousands of customers in a matter of months. We're backed by Rhino Ventures, Panache Ventures, and industry leaders like Greg Smith (CEO, Thinkific), Tim Vipond (Founder, Corporate Finance Institute), Andrew Wilkinson (Co-Founder, Tiny), and Pat Flynn (Founder, Smart Passive Income).
 Wizebank is looking for a talented front-end developer to help us build best-in-class software and financial tools that help online education businesses better manage and grow their education empires. As one of our early engineering hires, you will have the opportunity to take complete, end-to-end ownership of projects and play a critical role in shaping our future products and processes.
 What you'll do?

 You'll work with a small engineering team to build mission-critical tools for course creators.
As one of our early engineers, you'll have the opportunity to build entirely new products from scratch and make important technical decisions.
You'll help build the foundation for Wizebank's engineering standards, tooling, and processes. 

Requirements

 You are comfortable with the ambiguity of an early-stage company. This includes being able to transform product sketches into working technology as well as working in an environment with a fast-paced delivery schedule.
Interested in our core domain - helping solopreneurs succeed by building valuable financial and software tools.
You understand the importance of both speed and quality, and the trade-offs of choosing one over the other.
You have a positive attitude, with high integrity and low ego.

Technical Skills
 We're looking for someone with experience with many, if not all, of:

 1-3+ years of professional software experience building front-end web applications
Experience with modern front-end frameworks, such as: Vue, Angular, React
Experience with HTML and CSS/SASS
Experience with front-end testing, using frameworks, such as: Jest, Mocha, or Chai
Experience working with CSS style and component libraries
Experience building design systems, and componentization

On the front-end we use Vue (migrating from 2 to 3), HTML and SASS; leveraging Tailwind CSS and our in-house built component library (Tasty Bistro) to create a consistent style system that serves four different micro-frontends scoped by business stakeholders.
 We're looking for someone with 3+ years of experience building web applications, who has applicable knowledge with TypeScript/JavaScript, buildingand using a modern web framework such as: Angular, React, Vue, etc.
 Nice to haves are Vue 3 experience,building design systems, and working with Tailwind CSS.
 Traits we value:

 A knack for writing clear and maintainable code.
Considers the pull between readability and playing code golf.
Thinks about systems with clear folder structures and scoping in mind, and cares about leaving the code they touch in a better place for their team.
Cares about the product, the final user experience, and brings this mentality across the stack.
Problem solvers and thinkers who speak up about purpose and value of features and decisions; engaging in questions and discussions, pushing themselves and those around them for the best outcomes for all.

Benefits

 Recent Financing: We closed a large financing in 2022 and we are actively looking to expand our team to deliver best-in-class financial products to our customers at scale.
Strong Traction: We are experiencing rapid growth and your work will directly impact thousands of businesses around the world.
Autonomy & Ownership: You'll have the opportunity to create your own path and own your work.
Impact: You will get to shape the culture of Wizebank. "The early team you build is the company you build." Your impact will be immediate and lasting.
Competitive Compensation: We reward great work and want to attract the best talent.
Work From Home Stipend: We cover the essentials including laptops, accessories, and more.
Learning & Development Stipend: We provide a personal development budget covering courses, books, events and more.
Extended Health Care Benefits: Comprehensive benefit plan and wellness spending account.

title: Junior Software Programmer (remote position)
summary: At SQM, our mission is to help call centres improve their customer satisfaction – one agent at a time.Through our mission and strategy, SQM fosters a culture…
job description:
At SQM, our mission is to help call centres improve their customer satisfaction – one agent at a time. SQM is a leading North American software company specializing in customer service QA management for call centre agents. Through our mission and strategy, SQM fosters a culture of transformation, friendliness, collaboration, and teamwork with a customer-centric mindset. SQM has locations in both Vernon, BC and in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho.
 SQM is looking for a junior programmer to augment our Software Development team and assist with new projects as well as further improve our existing software projects. Most of our systems are based around .net and SQL server. Applicants should have a working knowledge of C# or similar languages, along with an ability to write/edit SQL queries.
 Additionally, the following skills will also helpful:

 Proven programming experience
 Multi-tasking and time management skills
 Excellent analytical abilities
 Detailed and goal-oriented
 Ability to work in a team environment
 Ability to work effectively and collaboratively and be flexible
 Ability to set priorities and meet deadlines

 A diploma or degree in Computer Science is required.
 This is a remote work position with preference for those living in the Pacific or Mountain time zone in Canada. If outside of the Pacific time zone, flexibility in working hours will be required to align with the Pacific time zone. Remote workers must have a quiet and distraction-free working space with an internet connection speed of at least 50 Mbps down and 15 Mbps up.
 Some of the benefits of working at SQM are:

 Competitive salary dependent upon education and work experience
 Extended Group Benefits Plan with Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program, and insurance including short- and long-term disability
 Three weeks’ vacation to start
 Five paid sick days per year

 SQM Group is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all persons, regardless of race, religion, colour, sex, age, national origin, disability, genetic information or any factor that is a prohibited consideration under applicable law.

title: Software Engineer - Backend
summary: Microsoft 365 (M365) Intelligent Conversation and Communications Cloud is the platform that powers billions of real-time customer conversations across Microsoft…
job description:
Microsoft 365 (M365) Intelligent Conversation and Communications Cloud is the platform that powers billions of real-time customer conversations across Microsoft’s first-party (Teams, Skype), second-party (Dynamics), and third-party solutions (through Azure Communication Services). The platform enables reliable and high-quality messaging, meeting, and audio/video calling services that work every time, from anywhere, seamlessly across all customer touchpoints. Conversations on our platforms are made more intelligent in real-time, empowering best-in-class productivity tools for the modern workplace where every call, meeting, or chat will make the next one better.
 


 We are the team behind all the messaging scenarios across multiple products, and develop one of the largest scale, business-critical distributed systems in Microsoft. Our services run in 25+ regions, and we process billions of messages a day, enabling hundreds of millions of active enterprise as well as consumer users. The micro services are highly scalable, highly available, and extremely performant in geo-redundant, multi-tenant systems and honor data sovereignty, privacy, security, and compliance. You will have an opportunity to work with a highly collaborative and fun team in a fast-learning environment.
 
 Responsibilities

 Design, develop and operate features for large scale distributed software services and solutions.
 Adhere to modern software engineering practices through design and code reviews.
 Write clean and optimized code, improve test coverage for services, organize and implement integration tests, and resolve problem areas.
 Consider testability, portability/monitoring, reliability, and maintainability, and understand when code is ready to be shared and delivered.
 Gain a working understanding of Microsoft as a business and collaborate with mentors and leaders in order to contribute to cohesive, end-to-end experiences for our users.
 Focus on customer/partner needs through a data driven approach.
 Develop “best-in-class” engineering for our services by ensuring that the services and the components are well-defined and modularized, secure, reliable, diagnosable, actively monitored and reusable.

 Qualifications

 Required/Minimum Qualifications:


 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline.
 2+ years technical engineering experience with any object-oriented coding languages including, but not limited to C++, C#, Java or Python.
   
 OR equivalent experience.



 Preferred qualifications:


 3+ years designing, developing, and operating backend services.
 Ability to communicate technical details clearly across organizational boundaries.
 Experience in DevOps to maintain live services and/or application frameworks.
 Cloud and services experience, with Azure cloud experience highly desirable.
 Excellent analytical skills with systematic and structured approach to software design.
 Passion for building highly scalable, highly reliable services.
 Experience with or exposure to Agile and iterative development processes.


   #IC3
   #M365CORE
 

   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
 


 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

job description:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.

 Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.

 Our hybrid work model preserves the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interaction. The needs for every role are different but on average, you will be together with your colleagues at least once per week, with our leadership team in office three to four days weekly to be present for their teams.

 Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.

 About the role

 At Intact we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.
 Alongside a multidisciplinary team in a high-performance environment that promotes autonomy, you will work to solve complex problems and challenges and execute fresh ideas to help push the needle forward and meet the evolving needs of our customers.

 What you’ll do here :

 Participate in the development of major systems using new web and application technologies
 Improve and/or develop functionalities to meet the needs of users by designing solutions, solving problems, producing estimates of the work to be done and by programming, testing, debugging and documenting work
 Develop/support web applications and Java services in Agile mode
 Be part of the developer’s community, participating in the continuous improvement and best practices
 Participate in brainstorming to find technical solutions with other team members, making prototypes, as needed
 Need to interact on a regular basis with colleagues across the country


 What you bring to the table :

 Good knowledge of Java and/or Kotlin (Springboot)
 An Agile/Scrum/Safe and DevOps mindset.


 What we are looking for :
 If you have 3+ years experience as a developer, we are interested in meeting with you and finding out what you could bring to our team! We are looking for motivated, curious and resourceful people, ready to contribute and receive feedback and concerned about quality.

 Our stack : 

Architecture: Micro-services – Micro-frontends
 Web: Kotlin – Java – Spring Boot – Spring Cloud – MongoDB – Redis
 Tools: GitHub – JIRA – Confluence – Teams – IntelliJ – Postman – Maven - Jenkins
 CI/CD: Jenkins – Veracode – SonarQube – Prisma Cloud – Argo CD
 Hosting: Docker - Kubernetes – OCP – Elastic Search / Logstash / Kibana

 #LI-Hybrid

 What we offer

 Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team: 

A financial rewards program that recognizes your success 
An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased 
An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare 
Flexible work arrangements 
Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year 
An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle 
Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues 
A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs 
Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities
 Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow 
A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique. 


We are an equal opportunity employer

 At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard. 

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs. 

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

 If you are an employee of Intact, belairdirect, or Johnson Insurance, please apply for this role on Contact People.

title: Jr. Full Stack JavaScript developer (Ontario Branch)
summary: We're looking for Junior Full Stack developers to mentor and grow into superstars.Job Type: Full time, permanent.You know some JavaScript basics.
job description:
Position Title: Jr. Full Stack JavaScript developer
Reports to: Director, R&D
Job Type: Full time, permanent
Location: Brampton, ON
All successful candidates are required to reside within commuting distance of our Brampton, ON office location. Plexxis does not offer remote work opportunities.
Salary Range: $61,500 - $148,500

Summary
We're looking for Junior Full Stack developers to mentor and grow into superstars.
What You Will Do
As part of the Plexxis web development team, you will…

use react + node/express to create user interfaces and backend API calls as part of the ongoing effort to modernize our primary product offering
learn from more senior team members who direct your day-to-day activities
make meaningful contributions to a product that people rely on in their day-to-day business operations
grow into a strong developer as you build your lifelong career at Plexxis

Requirements

You like people
You are focused
You are supportive
You are driven
You like to work in a team but are fine working on your own when the occasion calls for it
You love coding and you love a good challenge
You know some JavaScript basics
You know some ReactJS basics, AngularJS basics, or VueJS basics
You know some NodeJS basics

Nice to Have

Personal projects that demonstrate your love of development
Developer training of some kind (boot-camp, college, university, etc.)
Typescript
OracleDB or any relational database exposure (sql)

What's it like working at Plexxis?
The dress is casual, but our commitment to quality is not. At Plexxis, the working environment is a social one - built on mutual respect and collaboration. We are a team of extremely hard-working individuals who have a steadfast dedication to delivering amazing results to our clients. As such, we make it a point to provide each of our employees with the tools needed to do their job well, including:

Competitive Salary
Benefits
Company gym
A games room
Paid after hours

Our team genuinely appreciates each other and there is an authentic camaraderie and support network.
About Plexxis Software:
The Plexxis Drywall Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software maximizes the profit and efficiency of wall & ceiling contractors through expert consulting and a drywall estimating software that unites digital takeoff, costing, construction management, mobile applications and accounting solutions into a single, sophisticated - yet simple system.
Since 1999, our sole focus has been dedicated to the wall and ceiling trade – a focus that has brought together an extraordinary wealth of knowledge, experience and expertise. From technology engineers, trainers and consultants, we have assembled the “right” people, the “right” product and the “right” service to deliver solutions unmatched in quality and customer focus.
Are you the perfect fit? Do you wish to …

Work with a small, tight-knit group of hard-working, dedicated and fun individuals
Enjoy the atmosphere of a rapidly growing, high energy company with an entrepreneurial spirit
Be on the winning team - poised to emerge as the global leader
Be challenged in the workspace, in the fitness room or even the billiards Café
Lose the stuffy environment (and politics) of “big corporate” and focus on delivering what the competition calls “impossible”

If you're ready for an exciting career with an industry leader, give us a call to explore your future. Growth. Learning. Opportunity.

 Disclaimer for all posting locations: We thank all applicants in advance for their interest but advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.   Plexxis is committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion; encouraging applications from all well qualified applicants. Accommodation is available for applicants, including those with disabilities, throughout the recruitment process.   Please Note: If you are offered a position at Plexxis Software, you may be required to agree to a background check.   PLEXXIS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

job description:
Company Overview
OZ Optics Limited is a leading worldwide supplier of fiber optic products, test equipment and sensors. It is located in Canada's capital city of Ottawa and established in 1985.

· Every employee receives full benefits including medical, dental, and optical and life insurance with the premiums paid for by OZ Optics.

Degree in computer science or equivalent work experience.

Turn requirements specified by non-programmers into working flow charts.

Develop multi-threaded application software required to meet the company's objectives.

Clearly express ideas, observations, and recommendations, both verbally and in writing.
Work in a dynamic, fast paced environment with minimal supervision.

title: Senior Statistical Programmer - FSP Oncology
summary: We partner with pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device organizations to provide the expertise and processes to manage and deliver on time, quality…
job description:
Overview: 
  THE COMPANY
 PHASTAR is a multiple award-winning global biometric Contract Research Organization (CRO) that is accredited as an outstanding company to work for by Best Companies. We partner with pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device organizations to provide the expertise and processes to manage and deliver on time, quality biostatistics, programming, data management and data science services. With offices across the UK, US, Germany, Kenya, Australia, India, China and Japan, PHASTAR is the second largest specialized biometrics provider globally, and the largest in the UK.
 Our unique approach to data analysis, “The PHASTAR Discipline”, has led us to build a reputation for outstanding quality. With this as our core focus, we’re looking for talented individuals who share our passion for quality and technical expertise to join our team.
 WHY PHASTAR
 Accredited as an outstanding company to work for, PHASTAR is committed to employee engagement, workplace satisfaction and ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We offer flexible working, part-time hours, involvement in developing company-wide initiatives, structured training and development plans, and a truly supportive, fun and friendly environment.
 What’s more, when you join our team, PHASTAR will plant a tree in your honour, as one of our Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives. So, not only would you get your dream job, you’ll also be helping to save the planet!
 THE ROLE
 Demand for our Functional Service Provision is growing, and we are looking for a Senior Statistical Programmer (Senior Statistical Programmer I and/or Senior Statistical Programmer II level) to join our fantastic FSP team. As a Senior Statistical Programmer, you will hold a technical hands-on programming role, as well as project leadership (if desired) - focusing specifically on oncology studies.
 This is a fantastic opportunity to work for a growing CRO that is recognized for its continuous learning and development opportunities, whilst also gaining direct experience of working within a pharmaceutical environment. Responsibilities: 
 
Responsibility for overall project delivery, including clinical trial reports and other regulatory submission deliverables
 Project management responsibilities, including allocating staff, predicting and planning resources
 Act as a study expert for multiple studies, with an ability to clarify details on analysis methods for the internal PHASTAR team
 Advise on internal, client and CDISC data standards
 Responsible for ensuring the team meets the highest quality standards, and follows the principles detailed in PHASTAR's internal procedures
 Function as a programming expert across a number of studies
 Maintain a positive and engaging client relationship with regards to statistical/programming issues
 Report on study progress to the PHASTAR management team
 Mentor, train and develop direct reports


 Qualifications: 
 

BSc, MSc or PhD in Mathematics, Science or IT related discipline
 At least 3 years of Oncology therapeutic experience
 Experience working within a clinical trials environment (CRO, pharma or academia)
 Substantial experience performing statistical analysis using SAS
 CDISC (SDTM and ADaM) experience
 Proven project leadership experience
 Previous line management / mentoring experience preferred (not essential)
 Excellent written and verbal communication skill

 APPLY NOW
 With the world’s eyes focused on clinical trial data, this is a fantastic time to join an award-winning specialized biometric CRO that is renowned for its technical expertise, outstanding quality and cutting-edge data science techniques. We offer flexible working, part-time hours, structured training and development plans, continuous learning opportunities, and a competitive salary and benefits package. We’re committed to ensuring our employees achieve a healthy work-life balance, within a supportive, fun and friendly working environment.
 Should you feel that you have the right skill set and motivations for this position, please apply! Please note that we are considering candidates located anywhere in the US or Canada, as this role can be carried out remotely.
 Phastar is committed to the principles and practices of equal opportunities and to encouraging the establishment of a diverse workforce. It is our policy to employ individuals on the basis of their suitability for the work to be performed and their potential for development, regardless of age, sex, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy or maternity, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion, or belief. This includes creating a culture that fully reflects our commitment to equal opportunities for all.
 Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
 Phastar does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact Phastar's Head of Talent Acquisition to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to Phastar. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and Phastar. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of Phastar. Phastar shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Software Engineer - Backend
summary: Microsoft 365 (M365) Intelligent Conversation and Communications Cloud is the platform that powers billions of real-time customer conversations across Microsoft…
job description:
Microsoft 365 (M365) Intelligent Conversation and Communications Cloud is the platform that powers billions of real-time customer conversations across Microsoft’s first-party (Teams, Skype), second-party (Dynamics), and third-party solutions (through Azure Communication Services). The platform enables reliable and high-quality messaging, meeting, and audio/video calling services that work every time, from anywhere, seamlessly across all customer touchpoints. Conversations on our platforms are made more intelligent in real-time, empowering best-in-class productivity tools for the modern workplace where every call, meeting, or chat will make the next one better.
 


 We are the team behind all the messaging scenarios across multiple products, and develop one of the largest scale, business-critical distributed systems in Microsoft. Our services run in 25+ regions, and we process billions of messages a day, enabling hundreds of millions of active enterprise as well as consumer users. The micro services are highly scalable, highly available, and extremely performant in geo-redundant, multi-tenant systems and honor data sovereignty, privacy, security, and compliance. You will have an opportunity to work with a highly collaborative and fun team in a fast-learning environment.
 
 Responsibilities

 Design, develop and operate features for large scale distributed software services and solutions.
 Adhere to modern software engineering practices through design and code reviews.
 Write clean and optimized code, improve test coverage for services, organize and implement integration tests, and resolve problem areas.
 Consider testability, portability/monitoring, reliability, and maintainability, and understand when code is ready to be shared and delivered.
 Gain a working understanding of Microsoft as a business and collaborate with mentors and leaders in order to contribute to cohesive, end-to-end experiences for our users.
 Focus on customer/partner needs through a data driven approach.
 Develop “best-in-class” engineering for our services by ensuring that the services and the components are well-defined and modularized, secure, reliable, diagnosable, actively monitored and reusable.

 Qualifications

 Required/Minimum Qualifications:


 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline.
 2+ years technical engineering experience with any object-oriented coding languages including, but not limited to C++, C#, Java or Python.
   
 OR equivalent experience.



 Preferred qualifications:


 3+ years designing, developing, and operating backend services.
 Ability to communicate technical details clearly across organizational boundaries.
 Experience in DevOps to maintain live services and/or application frameworks.
 Cloud and services experience, with Azure cloud experience highly desirable.
 Excellent analytical skills with systematic and structured approach to software design.
 Passion for building highly scalable, highly reliable services.
 Experience with or exposure to Agile and iterative development processes.


   #IC3
   #M365CORE
 

   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
 


 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Junior Front-End Engineer
summary: As one of our early engineers, you'll have the opportunity to build entirely new products from scratch and make important technical decisions.
job description:
Wizebank has built the industry's first "Learn Now, Pay Later" solution specifically designed to help world-class course creators, educators, and coaches sell more effectively. We're trusted by our partners to drive meaningful improvements in their business, and we work tirelessly to do just that.
 Founded in 2021, Wizebank has gone from pre-product to helping our partners generate millions in monthly sales across tens of thousands of customers in a matter of months. We're backed by Rhino Ventures, Panache Ventures, and industry leaders like Greg Smith (CEO, Thinkific), Tim Vipond (Founder, Corporate Finance Institute), Andrew Wilkinson (Co-Founder, Tiny), and Pat Flynn (Founder, Smart Passive Income).
 Wizebank is looking for a talented front-end developer to help us build best-in-class software and financial tools that help online education businesses better manage and grow their education empires. As one of our early engineering hires, you will have the opportunity to take complete, end-to-end ownership of projects and play a critical role in shaping our future products and processes.
 What you'll do?

 You'll work with a small engineering team to build mission-critical tools for course creators.
As one of our early engineers, you'll have the opportunity to build entirely new products from scratch and make important technical decisions.
You'll help build the foundation for Wizebank's engineering standards, tooling, and processes. 

Requirements

 You are comfortable with the ambiguity of an early-stage company. This includes being able to transform product sketches into working technology as well as working in an environment with a fast-paced delivery schedule.
Interested in our core domain - helping solopreneurs succeed by building valuable financial and software tools.
You understand the importance of both speed and quality, and the trade-offs of choosing one over the other.
You have a positive attitude, with high integrity and low ego.

Technical Skills
 We're looking for someone with experience with many, if not all, of:

 1-3+ years of professional software experience building front-end web applications
Experience with modern front-end frameworks, such as: Vue, Angular, React
Experience with HTML and CSS/SASS
Experience with front-end testing, using frameworks, such as: Jest, Mocha, or Chai
Experience working with CSS style and component libraries
Experience building design systems, and componentization

On the front-end we use Vue (migrating from 2 to 3), HTML and SASS; leveraging Tailwind CSS and our in-house built component library (Tasty Bistro) to create a consistent style system that serves four different micro-frontends scoped by business stakeholders.
 We're looking for someone with 3+ years of experience building web applications, who has applicable knowledge with TypeScript/JavaScript, buildingand using a modern web framework such as: Angular, React, Vue, etc.
 Nice to haves are Vue 3 experience,building design systems, and working with Tailwind CSS.
 Traits we value:

 A knack for writing clear and maintainable code.
Considers the pull between readability and playing code golf.
Thinks about systems with clear folder structures and scoping in mind, and cares about leaving the code they touch in a better place for their team.
Cares about the product, the final user experience, and brings this mentality across the stack.
Problem solvers and thinkers who speak up about purpose and value of features and decisions; engaging in questions and discussions, pushing themselves and those around them for the best outcomes for all.

Benefits

 Recent Financing: We closed a large financing in 2022 and we are actively looking to expand our team to deliver best-in-class financial products to our customers at scale.
Strong Traction: We are experiencing rapid growth and your work will directly impact thousands of businesses around the world.
Autonomy & Ownership: You'll have the opportunity to create your own path and own your work.
Impact: You will get to shape the culture of Wizebank. "The early team you build is the company you build." Your impact will be immediate and lasting.
Competitive Compensation: We reward great work and want to attract the best talent.
Work From Home Stipend: We cover the essentials including laptops, accessories, and more.
Learning & Development Stipend: We provide a personal development budget covering courses, books, events and more.
Extended Health Care Benefits: Comprehensive benefit plan and wellness spending account.

title: Jr. Full Stack Developer
summary: As a Jr. Full Stack Developer, you will work on the latest technologies and with a variety of clients ranging from the public sector and private to start-ups.
job description:
The role:
 As a Jr. Full Stack Developer, you will work on the latest technologies and with a variety of clients ranging from the public sector and private to start-ups. For Full Stack Development, our team uses modern technologies like Angular, React, Vue, Python, Node.Js, Azure, AWS and OpenShift. AOT being a leader in integration and analytics in British Columbia, you will also get opportunities to work on technologies such as computer vision, machine learning, predictive analytics, IoT etc.

 What you have:

Bachelor's Degree
At least 1 - 4 years of IT industry experience
Experience in one or more front-end frameworks such as: Angular, Vue or React
Experience in one or more back-end languages such as: Java, C# or Python



 What you might also have:

Experience in public cloud platforms such AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
Experience in Microservices implementations using Docker, Kubernetes and OpenShift
Experience in using API Gateways



 Some of our perks:

A culture of innovation, diversity, and inclusivity!
16 days of paid time off to start and increasing as time goes on!
5 paid sick days - take care of yourself or your family
Competitive health benefits right from the start.
Flexible work schedule - work when you can.
Remote work/ Travel & work
Brand new laptops and other equipment that allows you to work from home comfortably!
A professional development budget with many opportunities for training & career growth.
Fun Company Events!
Celebrations - Lunch is on us for your Birthday & Work Anniversary!
RRSP Matching - we want to help you plan for the future!



 About AOT Technologies:


 AOT Technologies is an award-winning, Victoria based IT Consulting company that specializes in application integration and analytics. We work with various government entities, large enterprises, and start-ups to build world class software. Our flagship product is formsflow.ai which is a free and open-source software that empowers our clients to serve people better.


 We are proud of our inclusive workplace, coaching culture, and the expertise we provide. AOT Technologies is Great Place to Work Certified™, awarded as one of the Best Workplaces™ in British Columbia, and the recipient of the Maclean’s Growth 500 award.


 We thank you for your interest in joining AOT Technologies! While we welcome all applicants, only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.


 We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: Youth Development Professionals
company: The John Howard Society of Grande Prairie
summary: The EUREKA Program: we are recruiting for a Program Coordinator (30 hrs/wk) to provide community based, 2-day workshops focused on self awareness, conflict…
job description:
Youth Development Professionals
The John Howard Society is a community-based non-profit concerned with the causes and consequences of crime. We believe that crime is a community problem that requires community-based solutions.
We are currently recruiting youth development professionals to work with youth ages 12-17 in two programs:
- The Tabono Centre: providing social and emotional learning for youth ages 12-17 within a strength based, alternative learning centre. Programming focuses on social & emotional learning, life skills, arts & culture, recreation and leadership. We are currently looking for staff who can contribute in these key program areas. If you have something to offer, we’d love to hear from you. We are open to considering part time or contract work (20-30 hrs/wk).
- We are also looking for a full-time staff (37.5 hrs/wk) to join our Tabono team. This position requires someone who can lead a new initiative, introducing and incorporate the wraparound model into our work with youth. Knowledge of or experience with social & emotional learning and/or the wraparound model would be considered assets in this position.
- The EUREKA Program: we are recruiting for a Program Coordinator (30 hrs/wk) to provide community based, 2-day workshops focused on self awareness, conflict resolution and community building, to Grade 7 youth, attending schools in our region. Working independently, the Program Coordinator is responsible for leading, delivering and managing the program. This is a great opportunity for someone who is comfortable working with a variety of youth and who is seeking flexibility in scheduling (24-30 hrs/wk), in order to better maintain work/life balance.
Please indicate on your cover letter, if you are interested in being considered for both or one of these programs or positions. If only one, please identify which one.
We need leaders in both programs, ideal candidates will be leaders who have a passion for working with youth and who can develop and deliver quality programs for youth.
We need team members who:

understand youth development and have experience in working with teens
are self-starters and who can demonstrate the ability to develop and deliver programs and content for youth
show initiative, are energetic and self-motivated
are excellent communicators (both written and oral)
like working as a part of a team but are also comfortable working independently
are creative and innovative, with experience in program development
can "think big picture" and also pay attention to the details
enjoy a challenge and want a rewarding and unique experience
are organized and have demonstrated leadership qualities
are professional and non- judgmental
have experience securing, supporting and fostering community connections and building relationships
are competent and confident with using technology
have a solid background in human services with related formal qualifications

Ideal candidates will have a background in youth work, education, social work or mental health and an understanding of and appreciation for diversity.
We offer a comprehensive benefits package, RRSP and an awesome work environment, offering flexibility, where possible and depending on the position.
If you are looking for experience and variety in your work, there may be additional opportunities available for work within our organization, which may be considered, depending on qualifications and experience.
Thank you to all those who apply. Only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Python Test Automation Developers
summary: Work with design/developers to perpetuate errors and ensure problem resolution.Motivated designers with broad backgrounds and service mindset to be a…
job description:
Are you ready to be part of a leading global engineering design house specializing in the design and development of embedded software/hardware, electronics, and electro-mechanics?
 


 What we’re looking for



 Highly motivated and dynamic professionals
Motivated designers with broad backgrounds and service mindset to be a consultant
 Professionals with ability to work both with in-house projects and on-site assignments at our customer’s locations

 What you'll do

 Carry out E2E, Functional, Interface and integration testing.
 Code automation tests in Python within a Slash framework
 Configure automation test suites and runs.
 Automation triage and debugging.
 Bug/Defect writing
 Analyzing product requirements and evaluating potential technical solutions.
 Work with design/developers to perpetuate errors and ensure problem resolution

 What you'll need to get the job done

 A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
 3 years of software development in Python.
 3 years software test/QA
 Scripting: Bash, BAT and PowerShell
 Experience testing IP protocols (Diagnostics UDS, DoIP)
 An excellent communicator, both oral and written.
 Creative and analytical thinker with a tester’s mindset.
 Methodical; capable of prioritizing work and working to tight deadlines.

 What will make us REALLY love you

 5+ years of software development in Python,
 Experience with Linux, ONX and Android
 Experience with VMs, working in simulated environments, QEMU, etc.

We're looking for Junior Full Stack developers to mentor and grow into superstars.

As part of the Plexxis web development team, you will…

use react + node/express to create user interfaces and backend API calls as part of the ongoing effort to modernize our primary product offering
learn from more senior team members who direct your day-to-day activities

You like people

Competitive Salary
Benefits
Company gym

The Plexxis Drywall Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software maximizes the profit and efficiency of wall & ceiling contractors through expert consulting and a drywall estimating software that unites digital takeoff, costing, construction management, mobile applications and accounting solutions into a single, sophisticated - yet simple system.

About CMiC
 Headquartered in Toronto, CMiC is a software company focused on the Construction industry. We have built a comprehensive platform for construction companies to manage their most important workflows. Our customers have their choice of a SaaS or Private Hosted platform that includes industry focused modules to manage everything from Financials and Payroll to Project Management and Budgeting. Our market share is very strong in North America and rapidly expanding internationally in regions like Europe, South East Asia and the Middle East.
 Job Overview
 The main responsibility of this role is to contribute to the development of RESTful APIs to support our front-end applications. You will modify existing APIs and create new APIs using both Oracle ADF BC REST as well as Jersey frameworks. Development at the database level is also required for this role to support the APIs. Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming Concepts and design patterns.

Understanding of J2EE and experience programming in Java.
Understanding of RDBS concepts and experience with SQL/PLSQL. 



CMiC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Software Engineer - Backend
summary: Microsoft 365 (M365) Intelligent Conversation and Communications Cloud is the platform that powers billions of real-time customer conversations across Microsoft…
job description:
Microsoft 365 (M365) Intelligent Conversation and Communications Cloud is the platform that powers billions of real-time customer conversations across Microsoft’s first-party (Teams, Skype), second-party (Dynamics), and third-party solutions (through Azure Communication Services). The platform enables reliable and high-quality messaging, meeting, and audio/video calling services that work every time, from anywhere, seamlessly across all customer touchpoints. Conversations on our platforms are made more intelligent in real-time, empowering best-in-class productivity tools for the modern workplace where every call, meeting, or chat will make the next one better.
 


 We are the team behind all the messaging scenarios across multiple products, and develop one of the largest scale, business-critical distributed systems in Microsoft. Our services run in 25+ regions, and we process billions of messages a day, enabling hundreds of millions of active enterprise as well as consumer users. The micro services are highly scalable, highly available, and extremely performant in geo-redundant, multi-tenant systems and honor data sovereignty, privacy, security, and compliance. You will have an opportunity to work with a highly collaborative and fun team in a fast-learning environment.
 
 Responsibilities

 Design, develop and operate features for large scale distributed software services and solutions.
 Adhere to modern software engineering practices through design and code reviews.
 Write clean and optimized code, improve test coverage for services, organize and implement integration tests, and resolve problem areas.
 Consider testability, portability/monitoring, reliability, and maintainability, and understand when code is ready to be shared and delivered.
 Gain a working understanding of Microsoft as a business and collaborate with mentors and leaders in order to contribute to cohesive, end-to-end experiences for our users.
 Focus on customer/partner needs through a data driven approach.
 Develop “best-in-class” engineering for our services by ensuring that the services and the components are well-defined and modularized, secure, reliable, diagnosable, actively monitored and reusable.

 Qualifications

 Required/Minimum Qualifications:


 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline.
 2+ years technical engineering experience with any object-oriented coding languages including, but not limited to C++, C#, Java or Python.
   
 OR equivalent experience.



 Preferred qualifications:


 3+ years designing, developing, and operating backend services.
 Ability to communicate technical details clearly across organizational boundaries.
 Experience in DevOps to maintain live services and/or application frameworks.
 Cloud and services experience, with Azure cloud experience highly desirable.
 Excellent analytical skills with systematic and structured approach to software design.
 Passion for building highly scalable, highly reliable services.
 Experience with or exposure to Agile and iterative development processes.
